gr.interamerican.bo2.creation
Interface ObjectFactory

All Known Implementing Classes:
FunctionalMocksObjectFactoryImpl, ObjectFactoryImpl
public interface ObjectFactory

Object Factory.
This factory supports the distinction of declaration and implementation types. The declaration type can be an interface, an abstract class or even a concrete class. The implementation type is always a concrete class. The implementation type does not need to pre-exist; it could be created dynamically by the factory.
The methods of this factory are declared as not throwing exception. This is so in order to make the code that uses the factory more readable. Any exception thrown by the method's of the ObjectFactory should be wrapped inside a RuntimeException.

Method Detail

create

<M> M create(Class<M> type)
Creates an object of the specified type.

Type Parameters:
M - Type of object to be created.
Parameters:
type - Declaration type of the object to be created. The declaration type, could be an interface, abstract or concrete class.
Returns:
Returns an object of the specified type. The implementation type of the returned object is the type returned by getImplementationType(Class declarationType).

create

Object create(String declarationTypeName)
Creates an object for the specified declaration type name.

Parameters:
declarationTypeName - the declaration type name
Returns:
an object of the corresponding implementation type

getImplementationType

Class<?> getImplementationType(Class<?> declarationType)
Gets the class that is assignable from the specified class and is used by this factory for the instantiation of objects of the specified type. If the type is existing (i.e. it has been created in the past) it is found in the Factory internal store. If it is not existing, the Factory first checks the available type mappings to get an implementation name. If no implementation name is found, the Factory uses a NameResolver in order to get the class name of the default implementation (i.e. gr.intermarican...def...Foo --> gr.interamerican...impl...FooImpl). The Factory goes on to load that class, unless (a) it is abstract or (b) it is an interface. In both of these cases the Factory uses Javassist first in order to convert it to a concrete class which it then loads.

Parameters:
declarationType - Type used as declaration type. Usually this is an interface.
Returns:
Returns the type implementing the type defined by the parameter declarationType in this deployment.

getImplementationType

Class<?> getImplementationType(String declarationTypeName)
Returns the implementation type that corresponds to a declaration type name.
The work is delegated to getImplementationType(Class type) as soon as the declaration type is resolved from the declaration type name.

Parameters:
declarationTypeName - Name of the declaration class
Returns:
returns the corresponding implementation type.

getDeclarationTypeName

String getDeclarationTypeName(Class<?> implementationType)
Finds the declaration type name for the specified implementation type. If the type was created in the past, then the result is found in the Factory internal store. If it was not, the result is null.

Parameters:
implementationType - Specified implementation type
Returns:
the corresponding declaration type name

getDeclarationType

Class<?> getDeclarationType(Class<?> implementationType)
Finds the declarationType that corresponds to an implementation type.

Parameters:
implementationType - the of the implementation class.
Returns:
the corresponding declaration class.

registerImplementationAsDeclaration

void registerImplementationAsDeclaration(Class<?> declaration)
Defines that the specified class will be used as declaration and implementation type. This method is provided as a facility, that lets the object factory be aware of concrete classes that do not implement an interface.

Parameters:
declaration - Concrete class that will be used as declaration and implementation.

registerFixture

<M> void registerFixture(Class<M> declarationType,
                         M fixture)
Registers a fixture that this ObjectFactory will use when the application requires the creation of an object instance for the supplied declarationType
The normal process for object creation will not be used if a fixture has been set.
This facility is meant to allow developers to specify mock instances to be created for a declarationType in certain unit testing scenarios where the actual implementation is not available in the classpath.
The fixtures only affect calls to the create(Class) method of the ObjectFactory.

Type Parameters:
M - Type of fixture.
Parameters:
declarationType - Declaration class
fixture - Instance to be returned upon a request for a declarationType object creation

registerFixture

<M> void registerFixture(Class<M> declarationType,
                         ObjectFactory fixtureFactory)
Registers a fixture that this ObjectFactory will use when the application requires the creation of an object instance for the supplied declarationType
The normal process for object creation will not be used if a fixture has been set.
This facility is meant to allow developers to specify ObjectFactory instances that will be used for the instantiation of a declarationType in certain unit testing scenarios where the actual implementation is not available in the classpath.
The fixtures only affect calls to the create(Class) method of this ObjectFactory.

Type Parameters:
M - Type of fixture.
Parameters:
declarationType - Declaration class
fixtureFactory - ObjectFactory that will actually perform the instantiation.

resetFixtures

void resetFixtures()
Resets any fixtures configured programmatically using registerFixture(Class, Object)
